bio.title: Who Am I?
bio.p1: I am Muhammad Nizar Al-Faris, a 16-year-old <1>AI Engineer and Digital Marketing Specialist</1> passionate about delivering innovative digital solutions. With 8 months of experience in AI-based web development, I help businesses turn ideas into functional and attractive professional websites.
bio.p2: What sets me apart is the <1>AI-first development</1> approach using various intelligent agents (Claude AI, Qwen Coder, Cascade Windsurf, and other modern tools) to accelerate the development process up to <1>3x faster</1> without sacrificing quality.
bio.p3: "Better to hire AI than be hired by AI" - this motto reflects my spirit to master technology. Currently, I am also deepening digital entrepreneurship, mastering Facebook Ads and digital marketing strategies for business growth.

feyd.title: Feyd Store - Islamic E-commerce Platform
feyd.description: E-commerce platform for selling Kharisma Qur'an with color-coded tajweed & translation. Built with Next.js + AI-based development.

caseStudy.challenge: Determining and integrating various essential features in one complex e-commerce platform. Introducing Kharisma Qur'an to a wider online market and competing with similar products.
caseStudy.solution: Using a combination of Cascade Windsurf, Claude, and Qwen to enable customization and efficiency in development. Focusing on product advantages (color tajweed, translation) and using Facebook Ads (Traffic Tsabit) to drive quality traffic.
results: 566 Link Clicks from Traffic Tsabit campaign

frontworks.title: Frontworks - AI Frontend Engineer Portfolio
frontworks.description: Professional portfolio website showcasing expertise as an AI Frontend Engineer with modern design & interactive elements.

caseStudy.challenge: Designing a UI/UX and layout that is not only attractive but also functional and easy to navigate.
caseStudy.solution: Leveraging Cascade Windsurf and Claude to explore design approaches, and conducting thorough research on other professional websites. AI was used as a powerful tool while prioritizing a human creative touch.

tilawah.title: Program Tilawah 40 Hari - Education Landing Page
tilawah.description: Landing page for tajweed education program with AI-optimized copywriting for conversion.

caseStudy.challenge: Creating an effective landing page for an educational program with a specific target audience (Muslims wanting to learn tajweed).
caseStudy.solution: Persuasive copywriting with AIDA structure, clear visual hierarchy, and prominent CTAs across multiple sections.
results: Fast loading for optimal user experience

dapur.title: Dapur Ummu Kamila - Home Bakery Website
dapur.description: Showcase website for a home bakery business with product catalog & ordering system.

caseStudy.challenge: Creating a showcase website for an MSME bakery with a limited budget but remaining professional and functional.
caseStudy.solution: Focusing on product visuals with image optimization, WhatsApp integration for easy ordering, and a warm & inviting design.

khoiru.title: Khoiru Ummah - Educational Institution Website
khoiru.description: School profile website focusing on information about educational excellence & facilities.

caseStudy.challenge: Balancing an Islamic design approach with an international and universal nuance.
caseStudy.solution: Taking inspiration from renowned educational institution websites (UI, Oxford, Edinburgh) and combining design elements from various references to create a digital identity that is strong, inclusive, yet Islamic.
results: Strong but universal Islamic visual identity

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Answers to common questions about services and workflow

items.question: How long does a project take?
items.answer: Project time varies depending on complexity. A simple landing page can be done in 5-7 days, while an e-commerce platform takes 10-14 days. I always provide a realistic timeline at the start.

items.question: Do I get source code after completion?
items.answer: Yes, you will get full source code and complete documentation. You have 100% ownership of the code created for your project.

items.question: What is the payment system?
items.answer: Flexible payment system: 50% upfront as down payment, 50% after project completion and satisfaction. For large projects, can be paid per milestone.

items.question: Is there post-launch support?
items.answer: Yes, every project gets 30 days of free support for bug fixes and minor adjustments. After that, monthly maintenance packages are available if needed.

items.question: Can I request revisions?
items.answer: Of course! There are review and feedback sessions at every development stage. Minor revisions are unlimited during development phase. Major revisions will be discussed first.

items.question: What technologies are used?
items.answer: I use modern tech stacks like Next.js, React, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS. All selected based on best practices and your project needs for optimal performance.

websiteAnalytics.title: Website Launch Performance

items.headline: Rapid Initial Adoption
items.description: 8.3 users per day shows strong immediate market interest and product-market fit validation.

items.headline: High User Activity
items.description: 6.8 events per user (2x industry avg) proves content relevance and compelling user experience.

items.headline: Multi-Source Success
items.description: 3 active traffic channels from day one validate diversified acquisition strategy effectiveness.

items.headline: Nationwide Appeal
items.description: 7 cities reached in 24 hours shows scalable reach beyond local network and organic virality.

items.headline: Meaningful Interactions
items.description: 8s average session (2x portfolio benchmark) indicates visitors engaging deeply with content and offerings.

items.headline: Execution Excellence
items.description: Multi-channel soft launch with immediate tracking demonstrates professional approach and data-driven mindset.

dataAnalysis.title: Data Analysis & Learnings
dataAnalysis.subtitle: Extracting valuable insights from campaign data for better decision making

tsabit.name: Traffic Tsabit
tsabit.analysis: High CTR (2.37%) and low CPC (Rp 165) indicate that audience targeting and creative (short video) were very effective.

leads.name: 11/11-KM/Leads/Tsabit
leads.analysis: Very high CTR (4.62%) but Cost per Result is very expensive (Rp 94.372). Shows high clicks but very low conversion (leads).
leads.conclusion: Landing page or lead form needs optimization

highCpc.name: High CPC Campaigns
highCpc.analysis: Campaigns with high CPC indicate that audience or creative is less relevant.

learnings.title: Audience Targeting is Key
learnings.description: The more specific and relevant the targeting, the higher the engagement and conversion rate.

learnings.title: Creative & Copy Must Be Relevant
learnings.description: Attractive creative and clear copy greatly affect CTR and CPC. Short videos proved most effective.

learnings.title: Regular Data Analysis
learnings.description: Regular monitoring allows for real-time optimization and prevents budget wastage.

learnings.title: Landing Page Needs Optimization
learnings.description: High CTR but low conversion indicates the landing page is not yet optimal. Needs A/B testing and improvement.

actions: Optimization plan for Feyd Store landing page
Design new creative & copy based on insights

marketingStrategy.title: Digital Marketing Strategy & Process
marketingStrategy.subtitle: Implementing a data-driven approach in digital marketing, focusing on precise audience targeting, compelling creatives, and continuous analysis for campaign optimization

process.title: Research & Targeting
process.description: Determining audience based on interest (Quran, Islam, Child Education) and visitor behavior using Meta Pixel to understand customer journey.

process.title: Creative & Copy
process.description: Creating short attention-grabbing videos with copywriting focused on product advantages (colored tajwid, translation) and solutions (learning Quran made easy).

process.title: Setup & Launch
process.description: Defining objective (Traffic to landing page, Leads), setting daily budget Rp 32,000 for testing various audiences and creatives.

process.title: Monitoring & Optimization
process.description: Analyzing key metrics: CTR (creative quality), CPC (cost efficiency), Link Click to LP Rate (traffic quality). Stopping bad campaigns, allocating to best ones.

process.title: Reporting
process.description: Presenting campaign results from Ads Manager in tables, charts, and insight summaries for decision making.

research.title: Market Research
research.purposeText: Understanding target audience, pain points, and competitors
research.appText: Analyzing audience interested in Quran Kharisma and Islamic novels through Meta Pixel and Facebook Audience Insights
research.resultText: Specific interest targeting: Islam, Quran, Child Education

content.title: Content Planning & Strategy
content.purposeText: Defining brand positioning and content pillars
content.brandPosText: Quran Kharisma with colored tajwid and translation

execution.title: Production & Execution
execution.appText: Creating short video ads highlighting Quran Kharisma features with copy emphasizing ease of learning

analysis.title: Analysis & Evaluation
analysis.purposeText: Measuring performance and finding areas for improvement
analysis.appText: Analyzing metrics such as CTR, CPC, Link Click to LP Rate, Cost per Result from Facebook Ads campaigns
analysis.actionText: Stopping poor performing campaigns, allocating budget to best campaigns like "Traffic Tsabit"

caseStudy.title: Case Study: Feyd Store
caseStudy.subtitle: Real-world application of digital marketing for Quran and Novel e-commerce business

challenge.title: Challenge
challenge.description: Introducing Quran Kharisma to a wider online market and competing with similar products to attract Islamic novel readers.

strategy.title: Strategy
items: Focusing on product advantages (colored tajwid, translation, inspiring stories)
Specific target audience interested in Quran and Islamic readings
Using Facebook Ads to drive quality traffic to Feyd Store landing page

execution.title: Execution: "Traffic Tsabit" Campaign
execution.creativeVal: Short video displaying Islamic Novel features

learnings.title: Key Learnings
items: Success: Specific audience targeting and short video creatives are very effective for this niche
To Improve: Conversion from landing page to purchase remains a key focus. Further optimization on landing page and sales strategy is needed
